author: Adam Purinton
comment: The file explorer for the watch works fully but you cannot copy files from phone to watch. It just hangs. You can view files on phone, just can't copy them over or open them from the phone. Last update was from 2015 so that's probably why.

author: Michael Short
comment: Can't seem to copy files. I can only view file list and sometimes that doesn't work either. Would be great if it actually worked.
title: Doesnt Work

author: Dustin Hatch
comment: Works as advertised. Crashes if you try to view a folder besides the internal storage.
title: Decent

author: Guillermo Pedroni
comment: I like this app for its simple interface, it can move, delete, copy, view files. But it can't rename files. Would love this as a feature.
title: Good file manager, needs rename function

author: Francois Nguyen
comment: For wear to wear file operations in Android Wear 2 (the main reason for me to be interested in file browsers on watches lol), everything works great, so long as the file directory starts with "/sdcard/". For any watch to phone or phone to watch file operations, NOTHING WORKS...

author: UnitZER0
comment: You can explore directories, but only the "storage/emulated/0" directory. You cannot explore the root directory, which is what I need to do.
title: Functional, but limited

comment: Need support for UTF and othwr code.
title: Support for txt file is very poor

author: Farkas Gabor
comment: Copy doesn't work! Please fix it!

author: Luci Dorn
comment: It would be great to be able to manage files from the watch directly on the phone.

author: Jonathan Dale
comment: Does the job but wont open pictures on watch from my phone

author: Mike M
comment: Helped me out of a jam. Works great! Thank you!

author: rusty gh
comment: Doesn't work
Good one

author: Diaa Samaha
comment: Amazing app

author: Soroush Masoudi
comment: I bought this app and after that no icon or app shows at the watch , I thought that was my problem but I downloaded like a 3 or more apps after that and all shown on my watch apps, I don't know what's goes wrong but I'm not happy at all!!! It's waste of money and time. Update: it seems to be my phone conflicts , what so ever it's works but not as I was aspect's, no file viewer and there is no progress status while copying or other stuffs , that's a shame thou because free apps like "wear (simple) filer" do

reply.author: DMB
reply.content: [Updated Reply]: Hi Soroush. I'm glad you got it working. The watch app can view files. At the moment this is limited to text and images, but this will be expanded in the future. I will also add the progress bar you suggested. Thanks! There are also other features still under development. Thanks again for your feedback.

title: Nothing!!! - Updated

author: Derek Schmidt
comment: It crashes occasionally and has a couple bugs (can't delete folders?)

reply.author: DMB
reply.content: Hi Derek. Thanks for your feedback. An update has just been released that fixes a couple of crashes, and improves folder deletion (it's no longer restricted to empty folders). Let us know if you find any other issues. Thanks again.

title: So close

author: Timothy Shelton
comment: I've grown to love this app and it has loads of potential. Some ability to add short cuts to folders would be amazing. Love how it links to my phone.

reply.author: DMB
reply.content: Hi Timothy. Thanks for your feedback, and for your idea about adding shortcuts. It's a good idea and it will be seriously considered. If you have any more ideas, or find any issues then don't hesitate to shoot us an email. Thanks again.

title: Liked the concept

author: Vishnu Anilkumar
comment: Something that should be a part of Android Wear.
title: Awesome!!!

author: Muaz Al Khair
comment: I installed the app on my phone, but I couldn't figure out how to open it up on my Zenwatch 2, the instructions said 'say start file boss' I tried but Google gave me something else. Second choice was to scroll to 'start'  and pick file boss, I don't see any 'start' . I scrolled to my app list, I couldn't find the app as well, please help.
title: Doesn't work

author: Michael Wolbert
comment: I can move. txt files 100kb   .mp3 files 4mb  but podcasts in the 80mb range cause Google play services to crash indefinitely, needed to uninstall Android wear companion app and clear cache, it was a nightmare, reset watch still don't know what the issue is...  i don't know why Sony, Google who ever thinks I'm going to load a measly 2GB of "music" on here, i think a lot of outdoor fitness folks like myself are listening to 1hr+ podcasts with current events, or audio books... too bad for this bug
title: Buggy

author: ousmat azz
comment: Cant get phone files

author: Tom Miller
comment: Bs
